Reviews.Title: “Great Visit”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: Great Staff, Julia was great and the night sihft girls helped out alot. I am glad we were able to bring the dog. It was a great location for all our needs. Its close to a Walmart for those items that we may of fogot to pack.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a couple of nights”
Reviews.Author: malowe701
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights while visiting Branson. Our first visit to Branson. We chose La Quinta because we had stayed at a La Quinta in Dodge City, Kansas the night before. It looks like a retrofit of some other motel, actually two motels side-by-side. There has to be many thousands of rooms in Branson where one could stay. Both chain motels and independent motels. The wallpaper was coming loose at the ceiling and there were places on the wall where the chair marred the wall. But there was laminate wood flooring which looked new-ish. The rest was a normal motel room layout. Free breakast was the same one gets at most chain motels. No scrambled eggs though.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly nice.”
Reviews.Author: Gilley2001
Reviews.Content: Although this property was nothing special from the outside, my room had apparently been recently renovated. It was quite large, had a wood laminate floor and a very comfortable bed. They have done away the polyester bedspread and gone to a simpler (cleaner?) linen cover instead. The bathroom was clean and as a whole, a good choice. Although there are all the usual amenities, there was no refrigerator in the room. Something worth knowing for a multi-day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For Us!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: I just spent 2 nights here along with my elderly mom and my pet dog. This place was perfect for us! This hotel is very dog-friendly, as they do not charge for pets, and they don't require a crate for confining the dog while you are away at restaurants and shows! There were grassy areas at each end of the building for walking your dog, with handy poop bag dispensers and trash cans. We liked the laminate flooring for easy cleanups, although our dog never had an "accident"! The room was attractive, smelled fresh and clean, and Mom enjoyed the coffeepot! We had requested ground floor and we were near the lobby and breakfast room, which was more than adequate! We appreciated the nice variety of the free breakfast, which included various cereals, fresh fruit, sausage, biscuits, gravy, boiled eggs, assorted doughnuts, juices, yogurt, coffee, toast, bagels, and fresh waffles! The location was close to good restaurants, shows, shopping, and other attractions. I will stay there again on my next visit to Branson for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Once is Enough”
Reviews.Author: revfish
Reviews.Content: On the positive side: the staff were friendly, the rooms were clean, the free breakfast had hot waffles, the pool and hot tub were very nice, and I got a great rate through a third party. On the negative side: the wifi did not work well, the air conditioner went on and off all night and there was no way to leave a fan going to lessen the jarring change in noise every time it cycled on and off, and the walls seemed to be paper thin allowing us to easily sit and listen to the conversation in the next room (and to be kept up by ridiculously loud and obnoxious snoring). Thankfully the neighbors chose not to be romantic since We had our two teenage daughters with us. If I was a super sound sleeper I might consider staying here again. I am not. Therefore once is enough.

Reviews.Title: “fun”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: Other than a couple of inconveniences, the stay was very nice. We had a poolside room. The breakfast was very good, for the most part. The dining area was medium sized, which was a little tight when it got busy. The food was great (the only complaint was they served cold hardboiled eggs). Except for the eggs, everything that was supposed to be hot was hot and everything that was suposed to be cold was cold. Several attractions were within easy walking distance, if you like to walk. All in all it was a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: This was a great room and very family friendly. The location was wonderful it was easy to get to all the places that we wanted to see in Branson. The staff was also good about giving directions to places when needed. Breakfast was good also. If traveling with a family you should try to stay here. The rooms were very clean, staff was nice and amenities were there

Reviews.Title: “Beware of theft”
Reviews.Author: 1huskermom
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we had stayed in this La Quinta Inn. The first time we stayed here was 4 years ago, and at that time, our stay went smoothly. However, we just finished a 4 night stay at the Branson La Quinta, and this stay did not go smoothly, at all! First, we argued with the staff about which room we were to stay in. We had made reservations with family, and we wanted to stay in rooms that weren't too far apart. Even though there were available rooms together, we were told that because we had made our reservations with Travelocity, we would be staying in the cheapest rooms they had. I was appalled that the lady at the desk had said this to me! Our room was clean, but the beds were very hard, and the sheets wouldn't stay on the bed. Also, there were no blankets or quilts on the bed, which made it awfully cold to sleep. The breakfast was poorly planned out. There are only a handful of tables, which were always full, and only one highchair. We had to take our breakfast outside, and sit on the curb with our children. The "hot" items, like the sausage, biscuits and gravy were lukewarm at best. The doughnuts were almost always gone. The worst part about this hotel, is that they stole from me. My wallet was stolen out of our room, and when the staff at the front desk was told of the problem, they seemed mad at us! We filled out an incident report, but were told that no wallets had been turned in by housekeeping. This got me to wondering, why would housekeeping turn in a wallet, or any other item found in a person's room? Aren't they only supposed to clean the room, not go through the contents of it??? I did fill out a police report, and now all I can do is to hope that the culprit's conscience gets the best of them. I will NOT stay at this hotel again!! Poor service, uncomfortable sleeping conditions, and theft are not my idea of a great hotel stay!

Reviews.Title: “Better than you can imagine”
Reviews.Author: Suesdiner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during our trip to branson with our child and dog, booked a queen suite very impressed with the room. Had a dining table and two bathrooms which was great for the family! Also had a separate couch and tv which the child loved and the room had so much room we didn't bored with each other while being in the hotel! I was not expecting this at all!! Well definetly stay again!! Highly recommend to anyone. Perfect hotel and perfect vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: EWheelerLousiana
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a branson weekend. This hotel was well worth the price per night. It is an older motel and the rooms are a little small but has been updated. The beds and bedding are new and the televeisions are flat screen. The indoor pool and hot tub were very nice and the breakfast also offered hot items. The motel is pet friendly. This is a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located.”
Reviews.Author: caramello51
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a friend for 4 nights, nice and clean, and very conveniently located on "the Branson Strip". My only real objection with it was that the WiFi did not work at all. I complained several days in a row, one person at the desk said it was being worked on and nothing happened at all. The next day the nice woman at the desk actually reset the modem, and it worked for about 1/2 an hour and then went down again. It also would have been nice to have a fridge in the room, but other than that, for the price it was a good place to stay. I don't care for the sugary food that they serve for breakfast but if that is your cup of tea it is very plentiful, and there is coffee and hot water available all day long. In addition when I left, I forgot my iPod in the room, I phoned the front desk from Springfield and they agreed to have UPS deliver it to my home in Alaska. That's nice service in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: This stay was in a good location. My dog was with me and we stayed next to the doggie area which was very handy. Applebee's was across the street. The breakfast was great at the hotel. The people at the hotel were very nice and helpful. The room was clean...didn't have a "doggie" odor.

Reviews.Title: “Quick anniversary getaway done right!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel for the last 5 years for our family vacations or quick getaways. We love the interior rooms and the amassing hotel staff. This trip proved no different in that is was an extremely pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Laura G
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms. Courteous staff. Delicious breakfast. My family's favorite hotel in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: abesmom63368
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, the staff was very nice, the location was good and the breakfast was adequate, but the walls in this hotel allowed us to hear everything going on in the next room (including which song played when they're alarm clock went off in the morning!) With the room doors facing the parking lot, everyone walking by was using their "outside voices" as well. We wouldn't stay here again just because of the constant noise.

Reviews.Title: “Bad”
Reviews.Author: Jcruth65066
Reviews.Content: Walls are to thin you can here the next room party and you had to kick the door to get in and pull your arm off to get out well not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good Place Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Maggie and Carl M
Reviews.Content: We like staying here, because it is close to several shows and restaurants. The last time we took our puppy, and he was very welcomed there. The "doggy area" is not too large, but we discovered another place close-by. Rooms were clean, and the beds were nice. We will stay there again. nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: Shelley E
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable room right in the middle of everything on the Strip in Branson. The rooms have been recently updated, so everything is nice and cheery. The shower was an odd color that I thought was mildew at first, but I think (hope) it was just the design. The breakfast was okay for a continental and the pool is decent. Lots of kids, but it was summer in Branson, so you have to expect that. Our only complaint was the noisy air conditioner. It was a reasonably priced hotel in a great location. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, reasonably priced hotel on the strip in Branson”
Reviews.Author: BigBroChuck
Reviews.Content: I got a killer deal for the La Quina in Branson by using Priceline. Our family of 4 stayed 2 nights in June 2012. Our room was clean. The beds were appropriate. The breakfast was decent. Our kids liked the pool. Only problem was that the lock to our door was broken. Maintence was there quickly and fixed it with no problems. It's close to everything on the strip in Branson. Staff was friendly & helpful. I would definately return to this La Quinta - especially if I get another good deal :)

Reviews.Title: “Another great visit in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: We really like staying here because our dog is welcome and is very comfortable with the location. It's close to everything, too. My husband is especially happy with the complimentary breakfast and we enjoy visiting with the lady in charge. She is so pleasant and friendly. I do think it's about time for some re-decorating, but I'm not a royal blue fan.(sorry)...Also, wish the bathrooms were a little larger. We stayed in one of the rooms for handicapped before & really liked that bathroom layout. Wish all of the rooms had those. Never-the-less, this is a good place to stay and enjoy Branson. Thanks...

Reviews.Title: “Hassle free”
Reviews.Author: Rickyrexx
Reviews.Content: I appreciated the fact that the hotel staff were friendly, never harrased us our dogs. Its the perfect place to stay if you travel with pets. Nice clean little area to walk them, the hotel supplied everything needed to clean up after them. Nice clean room, indoor pool was nice. Really good breakfast as well, will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain...close to shows and shops”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: This was a great deal for a property right on the "strip". Very close (walking distance) to several of the theaters and other attractions. Room was clean and comfortable. Front desk staff was very professional and helpful, offering maps and discounted tickets to area attractions. Great breakfast in the morning staring at 6 so you could get an early start on your day. Overall, a really wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our vacation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: We took our grandchildren on vacation to Branson. the hotel was great , the kids loved the indoor pool

Reviews.Title: “Not what's Expected”
Reviews.Author: Jack C
Reviews.Content: I have experienced a number of La Quinta's over the years. The quality of rooms are declinning. No closet doors. Wood floors. Bottom of feet dirty after walking across first time. A secretary's chair for use at desk. Not stable and rolls with slight movement. Even dumped me on the floor once. Stayed seven nights. Paid extra for microwave and Refrigerator. Used microwave once. Refrigerator froze up food. Obvious room converted from double bed to king size. (Had two rooms) Walls had the scars from the headboard where a standard bed was removed. Gray wallpaper and counter make for bad lighting in the sink area. Shower and bath area wall tile or shell looks dirty because of the black designed spreakeled through. Wall paper peeling in bathroom. Behind the door to shower bath was dirty with powder residue. Internet connection was slim to none. Card left in room solicitng tips for hotel cleaning? Had to go to front desk for replenishing kleenex and toliet paper. Katrina and Bo were very helpful at the front desk. Barbara very helpful at breakfast area.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Totosma
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Layout of the hotel is a little odd. Room was clean, but a bit noisy given the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Not to bad!”
Reviews.Author: Darkravergurl1985
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Quinta Inn for Memorial Day weekend. Stayed for 2 nights. It wasn't to bad at all. The hotel is located perfectly near walking distant to the Dixie Stampede, small shops, and resturants. Like most everyone says, the walls of the hotel are thin. if this bothers you dont stay. But really, why are you spending your time in your room? Get out and have some fun! You should only be in your room to shower and go to bed. But about our room we stayed at, There was nothing wrong with it. We didnt care for where it's placed at. When you look at the window you see a wall rather then the outside parking lot. Yes, the tv's are outdated, but again who really cares? The sheets are clean, but the first night the fitted sheet came and attacked me. But it was okay. The only flaw in the room is the bathroom. Our bathroom, in the shower looked yucky indeed. But not as if it was dirty. The shower wall was covered in this black print like it use to have something on it. Its kind of hard to explain. As if maybe someone worked on a car engine and smeared it all over the shower walls. But that black print was embedded and not washable. You can be bring your pets. I find this to be a good thing. We didnt bring ours this time but we did not have any problem with hearing other dogs bark and the room didnt smell like dog either. We plan to bring ours next time. The staff were nice and talkative. The cleaning crew were okay. (They really didnt know how to say hi) Lobby was clean, breakfast area was clean too. But people in general are dirty as heck and if you did spot a mess in that area its from stupid dirty people. The older lady whom was the helper was very nice and I would have liked it better if she had help so she didnt have to put food out and then run to change trash and clean tables. The pool was another thing we didnt care for to much at all. It was to small, alot of people that were there threw their towels everywhere and took up alot of the space the pool area had. Our kids love swimming, but they only swam once for like 20mins and they were ready to go. So this feature of the hotel is not to great for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Pet Friendly, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Gail B
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice hotel that is pet friendly at a good price this hotel is for you. This property does not charge a pet deposit or charge extra per night for your pet. Bo the front desk manager was very helpful with our check-in requests and Barbara the lady that was working the breakfast was fantastic. I have never been to any hotel with such a well run, clean, and well stocked breakfast buffet. All the staff is very friendly and helpful and this location is near Walmart, The Dixie Stampede, Ride the Ducks and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Get-a-way!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: Have been coming to Branson for 50 years, so I have stayed many different places. I was very aprehensive about making the reservation, but needed an indoor pool that will accepted pets. I was worried that it might not be clean if they allow pets. I believe our room was the cleanest & nicest I have seen in a long time. We will be making our next reservation in October at La Quinta. The one drawback is that you have to access the indoor pool by going outdoors!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation at a reasonable rate.”
Reviews.Author: Bridgeplayers6
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was conveniently located. Rooms were clean. Staff was very helpful. Free parking, free internet and free breakfast. What more can anyone ask? Made our vacation "perfect".

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, older hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tinslinger
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the La Quinta Inn in Branson, MO. The reason we stayed was that La Quinta has been excellent the past couple stays, so when we arrived in Branson and decided to spend the night, we call LQ first. I have to say that the front desk agent I spoke to on the phone REALLY wanted our business and matched a price we were quoted 20 miles up the road. The Hotel itself was quite dated, but everything worked and the room was clean. Breakfast was as expected with no surprises, but sub par in comparison to our previous 2 stays at LQ in other locations. The staff was so willing to please, we decided to keep our reservation in Denton, TX and headed out the next morning. Overall, the staff is what made this an enjoyable and AFFORDABLE stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Goldmine”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: This La Quinta is right on the strip in Branson, but is easily accessed from either direction. It is centrally located in the dining and entertainment area, much of it within walking distance. It offers real value, has a friendly staff, and has an unbelievable continental breakfast. They work at making you feel welcome and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: glmorgan
Reviews.Content: Very reasonable! We try to stay here every year. The service has always been exceptional. We have tried a few other places and always come back to the la Quinta.

Reviews.Title: “Still Good”
Reviews.Author: nanaMissouri
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this La Quinta Inn several times before and I must say it is still the same great hotel. The staff was very helpful. They had initially given us a room in the building across from the main building , but they moved us to a room closer and inside close to the pool. Which was good, a little cooler than I remember but the hot tub was nice and WARM. Breakfast was the typical hotel fare. The whole place was very clean. An the decor is just like the web site pictures. A little different but nice. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Trip”
Reviews.Author: Pamela S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a last minute business trip to Branson this weekend. We have two super sweet senior German Shepherds (both females, 10 and 11 years old) that were traveling with us. La Quinta was the 9th hotel/motel I called before I was able to find a place to stay for the weekend. The other hotel/motels I called had either a no-pet policy (which is fine) or a 35-pound limit or a 1-pet limit. Either you accept pets are you don't; I get so frustrated with the limitations. Anyways, La Quinta told me no problem and I did not have to pay a pet deposit either. They were very accommodating. Upon checkin, they even let us use a couple of extra blanets to put on the hard wood floor in our room to make it more comfortable for our big babies. We also had a 40' trailer we had with us and they let us disconnect the trailer and keep in parked in the back of their parking lot so we didn't have to haul the trailer with us everywhere we went. Breakfast was really good. The rooms are nothing special and this is an older motel but we really like the idea we could bring our dogs and liked the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Pet friendly, heated pool, clean room, complimentary breakfast, friendly folks”
Reviews.Author: Sam_Usa
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night this last weekend. Check-in was supposed to be at 3pm, but we appreciate that they gave us an available room, even though we arrived 2 hours early. We had originally booked a single queen bed room at the lowest rate, but they were nice to upgrade us (which I did not know until we got to the room) without extra charge, to a 2 queen bed room facing the pool. We also bought 2 tickets from La Quinta for the 3pm show at the Legends when we checked in. Ms Katrina at the front desk was very attentive, and asked if we would be using the pool and gave us extra towels before we head to the room. Our room 3306 was on the 3rd floor, adjoining the Music City Center building, next to Heroes Coffee (which I believe was the old Starbucks). As soon as we were inside the enclosed pool area, we felt very warm from the heated pool, even though it was relatively cold outside. When we opened the door to our room, the décor was just as pictured on their website – blue wall paint and 2 queen beds. The flooring in our room was carpeted instead of wood from the reviews that I have read, but that was fine by us – no funky smell that we could tell. Our room also has a small fridge, coffee maker, iron & ironing board, and plenty of clean towels. We did use the heated pool, but only briefly, because it was quite dirty (lots of hair all inside the pool). There is also a small gym room by the pool area with a couple of treadmills. TV has decent number of channels, but just a note (not a negative to us), if you come across some channels that are hazy, such as HBOs, it is because this establishment does not subscribe to HBO channels. Breakfast was from 7-10am, which was already starting to get crowded around 8am. Breakfast was adequate for us, with cereals & milk, yogurt, toast, biscuits & gravy (we did not see any sausage), hard boiled eggs, waffles, bagels, juice, coffee, and whole apples. The motel is across from Legends in Concert, and just few steps from Dixie Stampede. Nearby restaurants within walking distance are: Fuddruckers, Subway, and Apple Bee. All the staff we encountered at this La Quinta motel was very friendly, including the breakfast lady. We would highly recommend this La Quinta in Branson, especially if you are bringing your pet dogs.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay! Clean Rooms!Friendly Staff!Super Pool,Sauna & Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Rob R
Reviews.Content: We Stayed Here one night on 2/8/12 Receptionist was Very Helpful , Rooms were Clean! Breakfast Was Super! Pool, Sauna. Jacuzzi and Exercise Room Was a pleasant surprise! All Staff Was Friendly! This Place was Very accommodating for People with Pets! THANK YOU! La Quinta Inn!! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Very understanding staff”
Reviews.Author: Ealcwl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 2 young kids and a 75lb dog. (no pet fee or max weight!) The manager was super friendly! I was so grateful for someone understanding! I had messed up our reservation dates and instead of charging us for the nights we didn't show up for they credited our account! FYI- the pool side rooms are excellent places to stay with animals and kids!!! Pool & hot tub were perfect! Free breakfast also! Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “OK, but could be better!”
Reviews.Author: JTorsrud
Reviews.Content: This makes our 2nd stay at this LaQuinta. Biggest negative for this motel is: NO REFRIGERATOR OR MICROWAVE included in the room. You have to pay an extra $5.00 per day for these items. The Breakfast is average and needs to be improved. Good for a quick snack, but if you want a decent breakfast, get in the car and check out the area buffets, that are close by. This is an older LaQuinta and the Rooms and TV have not been upgraded in years. Our TV was very poor and hardly any color . Most newer LaQuinta's have Large Flat Screen TV's. Given the choice, we will probably look elsewhere on our next trip to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be remodeled”
Reviews.Author: Foodie53_11
Reviews.Content: This LaQuinta does not come close to other LaQuinta's we have stayed in. This establishment looks as if it were another named hotel prior to LaQuinta. To begin with, the floors need to be carpeted, the lounge chair in the room needs to be removed and replaced with 2 occasional chairs and a table in-between. The bathroom shower area needed either to be really cleaned or refurbished. The staff was friendly. The breakfast was typical. The sausage gravy and biscuits should have been hotter. The location of this hotel is very convienent to the Dixie Stampede and the Legends of Country buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Music City Stay”
Reviews.Author: Terry42343
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the room and everything connected with it including the staff, breakfast selection and attendant, price etc. The room was very clean and updated. Beds were very comfortable. Easy in and and out and easy to find. Our toy poodle was with us and had a lot of grassy area to explore and make him happy. Righkt across the street from Applebees and a crafters mall which everyone should go too. Almost next door is a store with "General Lee"; the orange Dodge Charger sitting outside. Great for pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: John2830
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this motel in Branson in good part to due to the very friendly and helpful front desk staff. Rooms were very nice and the staff was able to provide very good recommendation on the shows to see and where to eat. We would use them again. The free breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay if you have pets”
Reviews.Author: mtnhykr
Reviews.Content: We do not have pets, however, we had stayed there back in '09 and were satisfied with the room so we chose the same place for a 3 night stay 10/8-10/10. Asked for and got the top floor-best bet, probably the same room as in '09.The plus to rooms are the uncarpeted floors-you can tell houskeeping is doing their jobs just great! LOTS of dogs, too bad somebody left their little yapper in room (on 1st flr)during the day, dog barked at anything. Decent breakfast items, great front desk empoyees, use of house computer. Outer structure could use a little TLC as could the carpeting in the breakfast area. Mostly quiet during stay.

Reviews.Title: “Idling buses”
Reviews.Author: GoerUtah
Reviews.Content: While the rooms, breakfast, price, and location are quite acceptable, we were afflicted twice by extensive idling of buses in the parking lot. In the second instance, a single bus idled its engine for at least two hours--in fact, during all the time the passengers and driver were enjoying a meal in the breakfast room! As soon as the bus pulled up adjacent to our room to load baggage and left its engine idling, we had to shut our window due to the fumes and noise, turn up the TV to hear the news, and had to talk loudly in order to hear each other. This situation went on for two full hours! The desk clerks said that would report the incident to the GM of the motel. I would not again stay at this motel unless I knew that had developed a policy against buses idling in the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF THIS HOTEL - We will NEVER use La Quinta Again”
Reviews.Author: winstonmom1
Reviews.Content: We decided to try La Quinta because it was listed as dog friendly . We'd never stayed there before and saw a couple of negative reviews and almost went with a condo instead, but unfortunately decided to stay there and give them a try. The night before we left, I went down to the office and asked to pay my bill so we could leave right away in the morning. I was given a total and there was a balance due of $53.57 and I had her put it on my credit card. I also used a gift card and each time they ran it through it would get declined. Well I called the card company while I was in the lobby and they said La Quinta was "adding a 20% charge" to the amount I authorized which made it go over the balance on the card. Then the next morning I went to the office and the General Manager, Kirk Paige, told us we owed quite a bit more. I told him that I'd been at the office the night before and both of the agents gave me the balance due and I'd paid it. He said they were wrong and was extremely rude, condescending and told me I wanted to argue and accused me of not wanting to pay my bill. I told him I was going to write a review about the problem on Tripadvisor to make other travelers aware of the problem I had and he said "Well I hope you tell the truth" which I really took offense to. I looked at my bill on the drive home and found out that we'd requested a refrigerator which NEVER SHOWED UP, but the charge for it sure showed up on my bill. The rooms are small, and no frig or microwave. We will never use this chain again. We've done a lot of traveling and have used several different chains and this is the first time we've ever had this type of problem.

Reviews.Title: “Super Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: thepowellslc
Reviews.Content: Had a weekend trip in Branson, got a great price thru Priceline. The room looks exactly like the pictures. It was super clean. Probably one of the cleanest rooms I have ever been in. Loved the wood floors instead of carpet. Here is my one bad- the bed was hard as a rock, We felt every single spring - for my hubby and I we didnt sleep well at all. But that is just us. The staff was excellect. Very friendly, and helpful. I cant comment on the breakfast - there was so many people in there we just skipped it. We loved the inside pool - The waterfall was beautiful. The sauna was great and the whirlpool just had chemicals added - so it was strong, but we enjoyed it. We would stay there again if we went back to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!!!!”
Reviews.Author: skic486
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got home from vaca. in Branson,Mo. Our first nights sleep was just as comfortable as the last 5 nights that we stayed in the LaQuinta. What a pleasant surprise! By far the best continental breakfast, the nicest employees(Sandy,Barbara,Diana,Kartina). Anything you needed,they would do all that was possible. If you stay anywhere else in Branson, you are wasting your money. We won't let our family stay at any other hotel in Branson again. Thank you again to all the friendly staff!!

Reviews.Title: “WHAT AN EXCELLENT HOTEL TO GO W AN EXCELLENT CITY”
Reviews.Author: yatzee25
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this LaQuinta Inn was absolutely amazing!!! It is close to everything and of course right next door to Music City. our room was beautiful. It was roomy, it was clean and had a great view of the main strip. our room in particular didn't have a microwave or fridge but that was OK with us because we ate out most of the time. The breakfast was delicious and bountiful. they had a good selection and lots to choose from including yogurt, cereal, sausage, gravy, biscuits, morning pastries..just to name a few items. I'm not sure if all the rooms have adjoining doors, ours did. But we didn't mind it at all. It was as if the door wasn't even there because we could hear no noise whatsoever coming from the other side. parking is also not a problem here, their parking lot is well lit and spacious. I did notice that this is a pet friendly hotel, but that was OK with us because both the inside of the rooms and the outside of the property are spotless and very well maintained. WAY TO GO LAQUINTA!!! We hardly ever stay at any other hotels, they are THE BEST by far.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rwdawtravel
Reviews.Content: The only negative thing I can say about the hotel is the facility is probably 35-45 years old and is dated. It is meticulously maintined and expertly run. The rooms are all remodeled and in excellent shape. I really liked the wood floor laminate rather than carpet, it just seemd cleaner. The free breakfast was very nice with waffles, hard boiled eggs, sausage and biscuits and gravy in addition to all usual continental breakfast fare. The indoors pool, sauna and whirlpool were clean and on good shaep, but the pools smelled of chlorine and in an enclosed area it could get a little much.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: NomadicTeachers
Reviews.Content: Arrived without notice and got the last room but it was perfectly acceptable; good size, good facilities - including coffee in the room which we don't always get at home in England. As mentioned by earlier posters the pool and breakfast were very good and, for us, the location was spot on as we were going to the Dixie Stampede and we were able to walk there. Would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “There could not be a room worse than this one in Branson!!”
Reviews.Author: CharlieTurner
Reviews.Content: It appeared that they had converted a mop closet into a room. The front desk clerk was nice enough to show me the room before she rented it to me. It was the last room that they had and I was tired from traveling so there was no options for me and I took it, even after looking at it !!! Small does not really describe how tight these quarters were. Small would have been alright if the bed had not been so worn out. It felt as though I was sleeping on a sheet of plywood with a layer of cotton balls on top! I complained at checkout and let the manager know that I write reviews on me travel experiences and he said he would give me an extra 20 bucks off the charged rate. At the end of the day, I could have rented any room in Branson at any price and not done any worse than I got at this Branson, Mo. La Quinta....

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Definately Dog Friendly”
Reviews.Author: littleangel77007
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed here, and we'd definately stay here again. The rooms are clean and typically sized, the staff is friendly and helpful, the free breakfast is really good, and it's nice having an indoor pool. And we really like the fact that you can get a mini fridge in the room if you requst it in advace. I will agree with other reviews that I've read that the fitted sheets do pull off the bed corners pretty easily, and since it is on the Branson "Strip", it can take a little patience to enter and exit the parking lot at times. And I personally would have made the breakfast area a little bigger. (It's usually fine, but if you happen to go to breakfast at the same time as a large tour group, it can be difficult to move around and next to impossible to find a place to sit!) I will say that while we love this hotel, but it might not be great for everyone. We travel with our dog, and this hotel is definately pet friendly, which is wonderful for us. However, if someone is not traveling with a pet, and/or dogs and their noises are bothersome, this probably is not the best choice of lodging. There are dogs EVERYWHERE! You can't hear next door too much, but you can definately hear the room above you. And if there's a dog barking a lot, you'll probably hear that too. But, bonuses for people traveling with their dogs: I have yet to see the management enforce the "under 50 lbs." rule (there were 2 Great Danes staying 3 doors down from us), and I think having hard floors in a hotel that allows pets is a great idea! They definately stay cleaner! Plus they have nice little grassy areas for your pets to relieve themselves, and they provide poo bags and trash cans in those areas (so please use them!). This definately isn't the Ritz, but it's not priced that way either. I think it's a great value for the price, and it fits our needs perfectly!

Reviews.Title: “Luv LaQuinta...........”
Reviews.Author: gram2trips
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. Had an accessible room which had a large bathroom & roll in shower. Also had a higher commode. One of the phones did not work but maintenance fixed it right away, (needed a new cord) The breakfast buffet was wonderful including sausage, gravy & biscuits in addition to the other items. Luv the home made waffles. Very good cofffee. Has an indoor pool & hot tub which were both very nice & clean. No problem accessing the computer in the lobby, Coffee available 24 hrs/day. The only thing I thought the room needed more clothes hooks on the back of bathroom door. Also at the desk in the room was an office chair on wheels which isn't good for a disabled person. I was afraid it would go out from under me since it is on wheels. Very clean, beds very comfortable & room smelled nice.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: jailere
Reviews.Content: My Son and his friend and I stayed April 1st and 2nd here. Check in went well, with no problems. We needed a roll away and it was at our room before we got there. The location is on the main strip of Branson so there is a lot of hustle and bustle with people and cars. We were expecting that so it was no big deal. Our room was very average but clean. Everything seemed to be working properly. The big draw back was the noise of people from above and our neighboring wall. These walls were VERY thin and you could hear most everything. The first night there was quite a bit of commotion outside our room. A high school choir was staying there and were quite noisy for an hour or so between 11:00 pm and midnight. I almost called the from desk but the loudness from the high school kids subsided. There is an indoor pool which is very nice and a continential breakfast in the morning which was good. The staff was outstanding, friendly and informative. We booked through a discount web site and our room was under 50.00 normally it is around 85, I believe. I would ahve no problem coming back if I was in town looking for a cheaper place to stay. One just has to remember it's not the Ritz Carleton but nor is the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice rooms, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JSTL9
Reviews.Content: I stayed over the weekend of Feb. 25 and found the rooms to be very clean and comfortable. One thing that I found to be great was that the rooms had laminate flooring, rather than carpet. I don't know why more hotels don't do this. It's great for keeping clean, it looks good, and it's great for those of us with allergies (carpet tends to hold allergens). This is also great because it can be a pet-friendly hotel (which it is). The hotel is a great value in a great location. It isn't a a 5-star luxury hotel, but the staff was as friendly and attentive as those in 4 and 5 star hotels that I've visited in the past (without being phony - they're just genuinely friendly people). I would certainly stay there again and recommend the hotel to others who are looking for a nice hotel at a good price right on the Branson strip. If you're traveling with pets, they're welcome here too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, Friendly people.”
Reviews.Author: OsSmiley
Reviews.Content: My Friend and i stayed for 2 weeks at La Quinta. And it was good to be there. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. The rooms are clean and the beds are good. There's even an option to wash and dry. I only missed a small fridge and a microwave in the room. But for a next stay in Branson..."I will Be Back". Kind regards, Grietje Doek. (The Netherlands)

Reviews.Title: “Have always been pleased at LaQuinta.”
Reviews.Author: rjw1911
Reviews.Content: The most recent of many stays at the Music City Centre LaQuinta was as enjoyable as ever. We usually stay there if we are not going to a resort on the lake. It has always been clean and comfortable with a friendly staff. Convenient "head of the strip" location./ Close enough to everything, but easy to get away from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beyond my expectation”
Reviews.Author: TwoMSSeniorCitizens
Reviews.Content: After reading several negative reviews about Branson's La Quinta AFTER I had booked a specail package deal, I was scared and nervous as to what was waiting for my husband , dog & I. Upon checking in, the personnel was very friendly and helpful. The room was on ground level(no stairs) and a parking place right in front. Then came the room and what a surprise...it was clean as a pin and did not have any kind of an odor. I was very happy to find out that we were booked in a great place. We plan on returning soon and will certainly will stay here again. Great place for pets. P.S. The breakfast was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable bed and pillows”
Reviews.Author: Stlouis63021
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in La Quinta hotels before. This particular one in Branson, MO was not up to par. The room smelled of disinfectant. The bed and pillows were extremely uncomfortable. At night, the weather temperature dropped and we had to turn on the heater. Big mistake. It stunk up the room, so we had to turn it off and dress warmly. On a positive note, the water pressure in the shower was great. The free breakfast was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Get new sheets”
Reviews.Author: iowa44
Reviews.Content: the hotel staf was nice except one old guy yelled at me because i was in the pool area 30 min early, plus the sheets came off while you slept

Reviews.Title: “Improved - Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: 50StateTravelers
Reviews.Content: They updated the rooms since we stayed there last. New beds and furniture. And they replaced the gross carpet with wood floors. The bathroom door still hits the toilet seat but that's probably a design flaw that they can't do much about. Room was clean. Bed and pillows very firm. We had a discounted rate of $64 and we thought that was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “some good some bad”
Reviews.Author: allstar755
Reviews.Content: when i stayed here in november the rooms were clean. my housekeepers name was Rita. she was very polite and friendly the head house keeper did a fine job at helping her employees. the housekeeping section was great, then we got to the front desk. there was a tall guy who was really rude and disrespectful. then i went and ate breakfast and there was a young girl there about 16 or 17 and she was really polite and friendly. and while eating i saw the front desk guy being rude to other employees. and i wonder why he still has a job?!?

Reviews.Title: “Glad to leave and Go Home...”
Reviews.Author: sheilayvonne
Reviews.Content: These were simply the worst beds I have ever slept on and the pillows were half sized. The bathroom was smaller than I have seen in a motel in along time. To small to bathe in for sure, unless your a small child. The pool was okay, but we were so tired by the time we left (couldn't sleep in that bed) we were just so glad to get home. P.S. The front desk acts as if you were a bother to them...even as they take your money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Turfbum
Reviews.Content: If you stay at the La Quinca Inn Music City Center, you'll be within walking distance of some of the best shows on the strip. The hotel features and ample parking lot, incredible eating in any direction and a terrific staff. I found the room to be comfortable and clean. While I was a little surprised that a hotel of this quality didn't have a frig in the room it was more than offset by the very reasonable price (under $100 in the 'off' season). Their continental adds hard boiled eggs, waffles and cereals (hot and cold) to the usual pastry, coffee and orange juice fare and goes from 6am to 10am. Add to that about a dozen or so tables so not half the people are eating their waffles standing up. The staff are all fluent in English - um - something native to this area. When there was a question about availing myself of the hotels free, Wi-Fi services the concierge was more than helpful, even following up with me the next day to ensure that I had been able to get on. The location is right on the 76 strip. It places the vacationer 10 minutes' walk from Dolly Parton's 'Dixie Stampede', 15-20 minutes walk from Andy Williams' Theater, Baldknobbers, Six and several other great entertainent venues. I could go on about the shows but this is a hotel review. Turfbum

Reviews.Title: “If you want peace and quiet don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: happywandererSWUsa
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the WORST night we ever endured in a motel. My wife and I travel extensively and have stayed in motels good and bad all over much of the country. We average about 20-30 nights a year in motels when we aren't traveling in our motorhome. We go to Branson almost every year and since joining LaQuinta rewards program we try to stay in them whenever we can. This was our first time in this particular LaQuinta and it will be our last. I booked online and was not informed the room was next to the pool. We are in our 50's and tend to go to bed a little earlier than some but still we expect things to quieten down by 10-11 pm. They did not, the pool remained full and very loud until almost midnight. Our neighbors on one side were so loud that a little after midnight we had to call the desk and complain of them banging on the walls and making much noise. At least that did do some good. The walls are so thin that every time someone flushed the toilet next door it sounded like it was right next to your head. On the other side somebody had apparently left their dogs unattended in their room and they barked until after 1 am. The AC unit was loud. There was no comforter on the bed. The bathroom walls were bubbled and caulking was coming loose and the toilet plugged up the first time it was flushed. Not to mention a very uncomfortable bed. Our plan was to stay 2 nights. Instead we got up at 5:30 am, showered and left. We will stay at LaQuinta again but it won't be this one. We went down the strip to the Hampton and finished our stay. Very nice and highly recommend it although it was a few bucks more thought it well worth it. I guess there has to be a bad apple in every barrel and so far this is the rotten one for us in the LaQuinta barrel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Motel”
Reviews.Author: donandkaren1974
Reviews.Content: Great Motel, Excellent Stay..Branson is a great place to stay and there are several Motels, we had never stayed at the la Quinta before and we were pleasantly surprised with the pool and the staff, also they allow pets.The pool is indoors and heated., The rooms are all redone. Green with wood floors..Yes, I would recommend this Motel..

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel w/in walking distance of shops and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: 1huskermom
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed in a La Quinta before, and was a little leary b/c they allow dogs. But, our room was very clean and quiet. My husband really liked the wood laminated floors, as they are easier on allergens, and easier to get truly clean than carpet. Our room was very nice, and looked as though it was recently redone. It was modern and not your typical hotel room. The continental breakfast was on the smaller side, but it was nice. You could make your own waffles, or they had muffins, eggs, toast, bagels, fruit, yogurt and cereal. They also kept coffee and hot water on during the day, and it was nice to go down and grab a cup of hot tea in the evening. The hotel is located right on the strip, so it was very convenient to walk to restaurants. The pool and hot tub were nice, and looked as though they had recently been redone.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Serves The Purpose”
Reviews.Author: Team07
Reviews.Content: Location is good but......it doesn't really matter where you are staying in Branson because it is so spread out that you do a lot of driving and parking is very assessible everywhere for free. The hotel is nice and clean and PET FRIENDLY which is a good thing. The service at the front desk lacks in proficiency. We booked online for three nights and they were only activating our key cards for one day at a time and when we would go back to room we could not get in. They also kept trying to change the price agreed upon (and already paid for) through the Branson Tourism Center. We spent a lot of time at the front desk trying to explain to them the online booking. They finally got it on the last day!! The continental breakfast was a real bonus. It was good and there was always lots to choose from. Very clean and tastefully displayed. The room was quiet, we did not hear noises from other rooms. Very comfortable room with standard amenities. Would definitely stay there again but hopefully have a more knowledgable front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay at the La Quinta in Branson!”
Reviews.Author: Allie2009
Reviews.Content: I checked before making reservations and was told the rooms were remodeled with wood floors. When we arrived, we discovered a room with no wood floors and a bathroom from the 1970's. The room was poolside and the pool pump was very noisy (even through the door). The next day, I asked to be moved to a remodeled room. The staff was pleasant and informed me that only the outside rooms were remodeled. When we walked into this room, it did have wood (laminate) floors, but the bathroom was from the 1970's and was in need of a total remodel. We could see mold through the caulk on the bathtub. The walls are paper thin and we could hear our neighbors coversations as well as their TV. Above us we could hear 2 dogs running across the floor. The air-conditioner was so loud, we had to turn it off. We were glad to leave and will never return. Don't waste your money as there are other motels much nicer for the same money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: CoasterSue
Reviews.Content: All of the good reviews for this hotel are warranted. We loved the unique decor of the room and the fact that the air conditioner worked very well. We would definitely stay at this hotel again if/when we return to Branson. The only thing we weren't crazy about was that pets are allowed. We hate dogs and there were many of them at the hotel. Although the room was clean, we didn't like knowing that pets had been in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Pet friendly”
Reviews.Author: yankrose
Reviews.Content: We enjoying staying at La Quinta due pets being allowed. For this particular motel in Branson the location is perfect: close to good restruants & shows. Our room was cool when we ented it; we loved the fact there was not carpet (I am asthmaic) it was smoke free & clean. We were unable to get a king size bed or frig. which was a disappointment. Over all I would reccommed this motel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “The best Branson hotel we've stayed at so far.”
Reviews.Author: jiminyjillikers
Reviews.Content: We've been to Branson every year for the last four years for their Christmas celebration and have stayed at a different hotel each time. This has been by far the best. The location can't be beat. It is right in the middle of the strip. Despite this, our room seemed very quiet. Check in was very fast and easy. The room itself was very clean and looks like it has been renovated quite recently. I really like the updated, more modern style. The decor was very nice. Absent were the generic hotel curtains/comforter/patterned carpet, instead they had classier blue patterned accents (I don't want to go into an in depth description of decor; go to their website, they have pictures.) The rooms are hardwood (or probably laminate to be more accurate) which I thought looked very nice. My fiance, however, preferred they be carpeted. The bathroom was very large, and, most importantly, the bed was very comfortable. I believe there may have been an indoor pool, but we didn't check it out. I can't comment on continental breakfast either; I believe there was one but we didn't take advantage of it. There was a Starbucks in one of the attached buildings, though, that gave us a discount for being a hotel guest. That was nice, I do enjoy an occasional espresso drink.

Reviews.Title: “If you are visiting Branson, you gotta call LaQuinta Music City Centre”
Reviews.Author: Coastietraveler
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding in Branson, the LaQuinta staff were so helpful from the minute we called them. We received discounted rooms for all of our guests (the kids lived in the pool). Our honeymoon sweet was free of charge for our entire stay (contact hotel for details), it was a nice room with a hot-tub right next to the bed. John Conlee (country music legend) was staying and performing at the hotel; the staff caught wind that my fiance and I were fans and arranged for us to meet him. It was close to everything: dining, shopping and shows were within walking distance so we rarely dealt with the Branson strip traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic Clean, Nice!”
Reviews.Author: nanaMissouri
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this location before, but its been a couple of years. Nice inprovements. Rooms redone, new decor new laminate floors nice and clean! Granite countertops in the bathroom, but still no refrigerators or microwaves! Mattresses need to be replaced ours the sides were a little broken down and a bar pokes at your leg when getting in and out. Still love the pool and spa! Love the waterfall. Breakfast room is good. Could use another waffle maker. Long wait when busy. Batter mixed too thin. Staff nice and freindly.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: leakylia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient to shows and attractions. They have a great indoor pool and jacuzzi. The breakfast is delicious with waffles, bagles, eggs, and yogurt. We stay here every time we come to Branson. The staff is friendly and they allow us to bring along our dog, which is an important part of our family.

Reviews.Title: “By far the best place in town”
Reviews.Author: funnerwithfive
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights...Very clean and reasonably priced. Love, love, love the hardwood floors! No more worries about dirty carpet. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Every staff member I encountered greeted me coming and going. Beds were very comfortable, pillows were fluffy. Towels were thick and absorbent. Plenty of amenities provided i.e. soap, shampoo, blow dryer, extra towels, there was even an extra blanket in the dresser drawer, and three pillows per bed. Good water pressure in the shower, although the bathroom was a bit on the small side. Heater worked well and kept us comfortable. Looks recently remodled. Pool area was gorgeous and had great hours, didn't close til 11 pm. Breakfast was included in the stay and was great, well- stocked: muffins, cereals, juices/milk, cocoa/coffee, fresh fruit, waffles, yougart, oatmeal, boiled eggs. Starbucks is under the same roof and you get a 15% discount on your purchases there if you present your room key as ID (AND free access to the computers). Had PapaJohns Pizza delivered there with no problems. A great stay, will definitely stay again. Only 2 complaints: the sauna was out of order during our stay and on our last night we could smell cigarette smoke coming from an electrical outlet from either the room downstairs or behind ours.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was very friendly and welcoming willing to help.”
Reviews.Author: rochellecarter
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great. Staff was very friendly and welcoming. we WILL be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, one drawback”
Reviews.Author: hybridgal
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at this particular LaQuinta because it is very pet friendly, one of the few in Branson. It's been completely remodeled and the beds are super comfortable. Our primary drawback is that we arrive for the pre-booked 3:00 check-in and each and every time we have to wait. The first time we waited nearly two hours to check-in, the second stay was just 30 minutes but in December we had to wait 2.5 hours! We had plans that did not include our pooch and we needed to clean up from our road trip before we arrived at our next destination. Because of the staff's failure to have on time check in we were unable to make our appointment. :-( Next time we will be forced to stay somewhere else despite the fact that we really like LaQuinta and have rewards with the chain.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoybla stay at La Quinta, Branson, Mo.”
Reviews.Author: aref123
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean rooms, courteous front-desk staff, great breakfast they really serve hot breakfast that includes eggs, and also fresh fruits. Rooms are little smaller but ok. Only problem ,internet connection was not working at the wing where we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent thoughtful staff”
Reviews.Author: beckyanneok
Reviews.Content: The staff went above and beyond what was expected and way exceeded our expectations. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Associate01
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many hotels/motels in Branson over the years (at least twice a year) but this on is by far the best stay. The desk clerks were very friendly. They supplies us with all the extras we requested quickly (pillows, towels, cots) with great attitudes. The rooms were very clean and I especially liked the wood floors, much cleaner then carpets. The kids loved the indoor swimming pool and the waterfall was an extra. Breakfast was good and plentiful and the coupons to Starbucks next door were a plus. We will stay at this LaQuinta at Music City Centre again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sleep! Very Restfull and Comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: ewest062803
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, and rooms look recently remodeled. The pillows and bed were one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in at a hotel. The breakfast selection is fantastic. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome decor and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kbuttorff
Reviews.Content: The decor is great with wood floors and super soft bedding. Stayed there November 2008 and we loved it. Treated great, lots to eat for breakfast and friendly staff. We've stayed here before and will definitely stay here again. Also, great indoor pool and spa.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: TexasRaven
Reviews.Content: Spent nearly a week and felt like we were in the best place in Branson. The whole facility was in great shape and looked very inviting, The location at the top of the hill made it easy to find and get in and out of. The Theater, Starbucks, Stores, & Salon made it very handy, and we used all of them! The indoor pool( which had a waterfall), spa, and sauna area looked very inviting, although we did not use them I will the next time I am there. The buildings and grounds were in perfect shape all of the time. The rooms were very nice , beds and pillows were comfortable, and the staff kept our rooms in great shape all week long. Importantly the price was right ! We would recommend the La Quinta Inn Music City Centre in Branson, Mo. to anyone. We will stay there next time we go to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at La Quinta Branson Music City”
Reviews.Author: Luv2G0G0G0
Reviews.Content: We got season tickets to Silver Dollar City this year and have stayed at a different hotel each of our 6 trips to Branson. This hotel is by far my favorite and where we will be staying from now on! I booked it on hotels.com and got what I consider a great rate. The lobby upon check-in was cozy and the staff friendly. When I opened the door to my room, I was pleasantly surprised. The room was so clean and neat. The floors were wood laminate and had been freshly dusted/mopped. The marble vanity sparkled. The bed linens on the 2 comfortable queen sized beds were super white and the bed was made in a very inviting way. There was no heavy bedspread that I had to wonder when the last time it was laundered. Instead, each bed had a blanket sandwiched between 2 soft white sheets and 3 pillows staggered at the top. There was just a small throw at the end of the bed to coordinate with the brightly colored curtain/valance on the window. Everything we needed was provided including coffee maker, ice bucket, blow dryer, phone, TV, shampoos/soaps, kleenex, etc. After we unpacked, we visited the indoor swimming pool and once again, I was impressed. The pool was beautiful and there was also a good sized hot tub in working order. There was plenty of seating around the pool with pretty black wrought iron patio tables and chairs. It was very relaxing to sit and listen to the 2 story waterfall while watching my kids enjoy the pool. There was also an exercise room and restrooms just off the pool area. In the morning we had a wonderful breakfast that included Belgian waffles, hot and cold cereal, fruit, yogurt, toast, bagels, muffins, eggs, and a variety of juices and hot drinks. The breakfast room was clean, there was ample seating and the tables were decorated so cute. And to top it all off, we rec'd a discount to the adjoining Starbucks and salon just for staying there! It was clean, comfortable, and affordable and we WILL be back!

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: cstandfests
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights here and would have leaved if we could have received our money back. The bright blue wall was lscuffed up and scratched behind the dirty recliner. The mattress was very very uncomfortable. The springs actually poked out the side of the mattress. I sat in the dirty recliner to try to sleep. The wall was dirty behind the door. There were three tour buses there at the same time, so good luck in getting in to have a seat for breakfast, but don't worry, you did not miss much, rubber hard boiled eggs, rubber waffles, but the cereal and muffins were ok, as was the juice and coffee. I prefer carpet to the hard wood floors that were there. The cleaning staff was really nice, tho. So that is a plus. This is the first La Quinta that I did not like.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here!”
Reviews.Author: travelwhere
Reviews.Content: La Quinta was great for us because it was on the strip. Last time I was there, I kept getting lost, but not here. The drawback is that the strip is very very busy. There is a street at the back of the property that takes you to Truman and over to Roark Valley Rd if you need to go over that way. There are times that it would be much faster to walk than to drive. There are plenty of places to walk to such as the Apple Valley Mall across the street , which has vendors selling goods in booths that range from antiques to homemade things. It was very large and fun shopping. The Dixie Stampede and Dick Clarks, Applebys, Fuddruckers, Outback, Papa Grands Pizza all you can eat pizza for $6.99, were all within walking distance. I walked 25 minutes to the large Tanger Outlets stores ( turn at the Krispy Kreme) and would recommend if you like to shop. The property was well maintained. The room had very clean hardwood floors. The furnishings were in good condition. This isn't a lavish place but very clean and served the purpose well for us. I felt very safe there. I was very pleased with the breakfast that is included. There were hard boiled eggs, make your own waffles, cold and hot cereal, toast and bagels, muffins, fruit, juice, yogurt, etc. My 13 y/o grandson was resistant to go to see the Haygoods Show that was onsight. The lady at the ticket desk talked him in to it and he really enjoyed it. Very talented family. A big variety of music and instruments.

Reviews.Title: “Some good points, some bad”
Reviews.Author: leDeal
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at La Quinta for 3 nights and I chose it because of the decent reviews on Trip Advisor. First of all.... The location is great. Its on the strip, but closer to the beginning (nearer to HWY 65) so you cut out some of the traffic. The check in was easy and the woman working was very friendly and accomodating. The pool and hot tub were very clean and my kids loved it. The free breakfast has a decent variety (yummy waffles) and the staff was very helpful as well. Our room was OK. The location was a bit strange though. We requested a poolside room and apparently there is only one. It was a room on the first floor, but kind of tucked away in the back of the hotel by the fitness/sauna area. You had to go thru a door/stairwell to get to it and there was no outside window so we kind of felt like we were in a dungeon! It worked out well for us though, since it had easy access to the pool. There was a musty odor outside our room and in the stairwell. As far as the beds go, they were comfortable and the bedding was nice. Although the pillows were hard and too big and we all had stiff necks! When I made the reservation, I was quoted $66 per night, but when I was checking out they were going to charge me over $100 per night. The man working got a bit annoyed because I kept insisting on the price I was quoted. Finally, after asking for a manager, he was able to find a rate of $63 per night and we settled on that. All in all, it was a fine hotel for the price. Im sure you could find a nicer hotel, but you will also have to pay alot more for it!

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: OK_traveler999
Reviews.Content: Stayed at La Quinta for one night in a 2 queen bed room with 2 adults and 2 kids. The GOOD: Easy checkin/checkout, very clean room, excellent bedding, central location. The room had hardwood floors, extremely soft bedding, and nice furniture. Excellent indoor pool area and decent continental breakfast. The BAD: loud heating unit, small room, small vanity area was exposed to rest of room with no door, and tiny shower/toilet room too small to change clothes in. Not good for mixed company. The UGLY: Parking is directly outside of the rooms in many cases, and insulation is poor. We found out that La Quinta is Spanish for "no wake up call needed - diesel pickup truck 5 feet from your door will wake you at 6:30 am..." Recommend if you are staying at this motel to stay on the 3rd floor or in a room away from parking area if that is possible.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Getaway”
Reviews.Author: scshino
Reviews.Content: My husband and I rarely have an opportunity to go on a date, so several years ago, we decided that we would take an annual trip to Branson, MO to celebrate our anniversary. Every year, we stay at the La Quinta Inn. We love it there! We stay in one of the suites. The jacuzzi tub always helps me relax! We hardly leave the premisis because there's so much to do at the hotel. They have free continental breakfast, they have a starbucks coffee shop, live show, a beautiful pool area, and more! Everyone is very friendly and helpful. Isn't that what you want when you stay somewhere? It's always wondeful when you can get away with the one you love and feel like you have no responsibilities. That's what's great about this place. I hope this encourages you to stay at the La Quinta Inn!

Reviews.Title: “TopTalent on 76”
Reviews.Author: orangetiger
Reviews.Content: It starts with location, on the main entertainment strip, 76 and close to downtown and the new "Landings" entertainment center. The hotel is in the same building as the Music City Theater and Starbucks. The rooms are good size and well kept. One day we were using the room so they couldn't get in to clean, later that afternoon, there was a bag on the handle with a fresh set of towels, nice touch. The indoor pool and hot tub are better than most. A beautiful waterfall and large windows to the outside made this an excellent place to relax. There is a breakfast buffet in the morning with plenty of room to sit and graze. During our stay we never were waiting for things to be refilled. Best of all was the warm and friendly staff at the front desk. Obviously well managed, we will be staying here everytime we visit the Branson area.

Reviews.Title: “just to get away”
Reviews.Author: paul482
Reviews.Content: tired of work and kids just needed to get away ! the property was great,nice warm indoor pool and a relaxing hot tub. did get to see the haygoods while i was there,it was a good show.everything i needed was walking distance, it was a nice 2 days.

Reviews.Title: “Loved LaQuinta Branson”
Reviews.Author: jpeter1067
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a visit to Branson Missouri and were fortunate to stay at the LaQuinta. The rooms are well kept, clean, and overall really nice. The indoor pool and the accompanying area is beautiful. The continental breakfast is more than adequate. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Overall I would say this is probably one of the best hotels we have stayed in and I am extremely picky!

Reviews.Title: “La Quita Inn - Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: glting49
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the La Quita Inn in Branson Missouri last month. Our stay was very nice with no problems. The room was nice and clean and the staff was very helpful. The location was excellent for the busy Branson roads and we could walk to several good resturants. They provided a continental breakfast that was good with many choices. We have only good things to say about our experience and would stay there again without hesitation. Thanks La Quita!

Reviews.Title: “Watch your credit card bill CLOSELY!!”
Reviews.Author: Rt66Honeymoon
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and more updated than I expected based on previous visits to Branson. The free breakfast was decent, and because of the available wifi, we were able to find a shortcut from the parking lot to one of Branson’s bypass routes. That was a lifesaver! However, we had some issues with the front desk. I booked 3 rooms. The hotel ignored my request to put our party together although rooms near me sat empty. The real trouble showed when we got our credit card bills. All rooms were originally booked on my credit card, and the others in my party gave the hotel their own cards with then arrived. We all checked out at different times, yet all of us had billing issues: I had a total of five charges on my credit card in a single day, another member of my party got charged twice, the third not at all – although they were under the impression they paid before they left. While the hotel did correct their mistakes, they could not explain why there were so many charges on my account.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice for a 2* motel, Great pool!”
Reviews.Author: Beth76
Reviews.Content: We don't usually stay in motels like this, but were traveling with family that chose this place. We've never been to Branson before either. Check-in was fairly quick and the room was clean and big enough since we were only there 2 nights. We had a poolside room and I would recommend this if you have kids who want to use the pool. The pool was great for us because the shallow end was only 2 feet deep. Having small kids it allowed us to let the kids go in the pool alone (with us sitting at the side). The deep end went to 8 feet I think. The pool area was nice with a pretty fountain and a hot tub. The hot tub was a perfect temperature for me. The breakfast was ok--a few cold cereals, bagels, toast, donuts, waffles, milk, juice and coffee. Considering it was free, I suppose it was pretty good. There was always someone refilling empty containers and there was always an empty table even though the hotel was full. The first night we saw the Haygoods show which was connected to the hotel. The show was excellent and the location couldn't be beat. We actually went back to our room for intermission. We ate dinner at the Rib Crib next door so we didn't have to deal with any traffic that first day. The traffic to Silver Dollar City the next day was a completely different story though.

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn Branson on the Strip
HotelInfo.Address: 1835 West Hwy 76, Branson, MO 65616
